Howard Stern to David Letterman : sorry about your sex scandal( video) Instead of deflecting Howard Stern 's apology, David Letterman responded with candor and a bit of reciprocal praise. "You have been very, very nice to me on the radio and viciously ugly to me on the radio and I except both with equanimity because I know a little bit about how you operate and I'm still fond of your talent and your ability and what you've represented to the United States of America-and of course, the world. The prime minister said: I am very sorry that Andy Coulson has decided to resign as my director of communications, although I understand that the continuing pressures on him and his family mean that he feels compelled to do so. "I believe it would be appropriate for the prime minister to come to the Commons to explain why this is happening and give the public the full details here in the House of Commons, rather than bury this news " " Andy Coulson has told me that the focus on him was impeding his ability to do his job and was starting to prove a distraction for the government." Dick Cheney made a surprise appearance Thursday at the Conservative Political Action Committee Convention to present the former two-time defense secretary an award. The vice president joked that Donald Rumsfeld twice served as defense secretary and added that maybe if we give him a third term, he might get it right. Dick Cheney also drew laughs when he wondered aloud if Donald Rumsfeld may have more influence on Mr. Barack Obama than the president's current advisers. Mr. Barack Obama campaigned against the Bush White House's national security policies
